page.title: 12ETHERLEY - HISTORY - 2
page.content: Wages in the mining Industry have improved as the following figures show: 1940 Â£3-7s-6d (Â£3.375) (6 day week) 1968 Â£24.5 (5 day week) 1984 Â£100 All of these represent average pay with overtime. The average family in Etherley in 1925 was seven children. Now it is less than half that figure. Television plays a big part in peoples lives, but there is a sense that discipline and respect for authority has been lost. Churches are less than half full on a Sunday. Some buildings in Etherley date back to 1864. The first estate in Etherley was at St. Cuthbert's Avenue and Bankwell Drive was the first private Estate.
